thread.title: Kerry mulling ways to monitor fishermen at sea
thread.title_full: Kerry mulling ways to monitor fishermen at sea | Washington Examiner

author: Pete Kasperowicz
title: Kerry mulling ways to monitor fishermen at sea
text:
Secretary of State John Kerry said Monday that he and other world leaders are discussing how they can use technology to monitor fishermen around the world to make sure they don't illegally fish certain areas or use illegal fishing methods.
"We don't have policemen in boats out in those unregulated areas," Kerry told an audience in Chile at the Our Ocean 2015 conference. "So they bring in their fish, load it into airplanes, and it flies to major cities in the world, and people eat [it], and they don't even know they're eating illegally."
"So one of the things we're talking about at this conference is, how do we put enforcement in place in difficult places," Kerry added. "And with modern technology, this should be possible, to be able to track fishers, fishermen."
Kerry is an avid environmentalist and has made a point of drawing attention to environmental issues in his post. Aside from overfishing, Kerry said countries need to worry about pollution, including trash but also chemicals that can seep into the water supply.
